alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Floyd; Worth (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 4:31AM CST until March 02 at 3:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Winnebago River at Mason City affecting Worth, Floyd and Cerro Gordo Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winnebago River at Mason City. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Sandbagging occurs on the dike from 12th Street Northeast to Carolina Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM CST Tuesday was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling to 8.0 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
